column4: So, uh... I've followed this guide to Diskless Ubuntu ( https://help.ubuntu.com/community/DisklessUbuntuHowto ) and it's not working
it's not working is a fairly vague statement...
(sorry, not very fast typer today :-)
Not much experience with Diskless boots, but can you see if it tried to access the NFS?
unfortunately I can't see a way to determine that. I've taken a picture of the screen and am about to paste it... (this will take a minute)
Would there be logs on your server?
I suppose so. What log file do I check to see if mounting has been attempted?
Honestly, I'm not sure
http://www.naptastic.com/david/bootfail.jpg <- this is where the machine stops.
I really appreciate you trying to help me with something outside your expertise :-)
It's actually kind of half-inside, half-outside my expertise :)
lol :-)
I would look into seeing if it accessed the NFS...
Alright, thanks
Seems to me that it's waiting on the NFS server...
Which should be 192.168.0.64
yep. The mullet server. (Don't ask. ;-) I'm perusing logs now...
could you pastebin /tftpboot/pxelinux.cfg/default ?
yep, just a sec
here: http://fpaste.org/pxri/
(pastebin.org was slow / down so I used fpaste ;-)
I see nothing wrong here... The best reason I can explain the sudden stop without errors is that it's waiting on the NFS server.
agreed. I'm looking at NFS logs right now...
I'd never used Wireshark before. Holy crap it's cool!!! Anyway, I can see that there is a bunch of NFS traffic going between my client and server, looking things up, accessing things...
